@saquon: Birthplace of Dreams

‚ÄúBefore I was Saquon Barkley the football player, these are the people who loved me first.‚Äù - @saquon
‚†Ä
If you want to know who Saquon Barkley is, you‚Äôve got to go way back.
‚†Ä
Back before he won the NFL's Rookie of the Year award. Before he became Penn State rushing royalty. Even before he ran into Whitehall High School‚Äôs record books.
‚†Ä
Before all of that, Saquon's story began on the blacktop of The Bronx.
‚†Ä
This is his Birthplace of Dreams. #justdoit

Nike Helden

Helden features a new generation of German athletes, who work hard on and off the pitch, on the track and in their communities. They don‚Äôt just focus on the win, they pave the way for others and push culture in a positive direction.
‚†Ä
We believe in a world in which everyone can become a hero, leveraging the powerful platform sport provides to those who speak up.
‚†Ä
You never do it just for yourself.
(Du tust es nie nur f√ºr dich.)
#justdoit

‚ÄúPeople going through these kind of struggles need support‚Ä¶ For 17 years I struggled with my sexuality. When I was in college, I used to cry to my best friend because I didn‚Äôt feel like I belonged, like the guys on the team didn‚Äôt like me. My best friend told me to be yourself, go out there and work hard, and that‚Äôs what I did on the track because I had something to prove, I didn‚Äôt let that circumstance define who I was.‚Äù @KerronClement
‚†Ä
On National Coming Out Day, we celebrated safe, inclusive spaces for LGBTQIA+ athletes and the power of sport for all at the LA City College Track. #BETRUE #UntilWeAllWin

‚ÄúI kept saying, ‚Äòtomorrow is my day.‚Äô I wanted to be the second @kipchogeeliud ‚Äî the Kipchoge for women. I focused on that.‚Äù
‚†Ä
At 25 years old #BrigidKosgei is now the fastest woman on earth. In a weekend of broken barriers, Brigid shattered @paula_radcliffe‚Äôs 16-year-old marathon world record by 81 seconds.
‚†Ä
Don‚Äôt change your dreams, change the world‚Ä¶ And the world record, while you‚Äôre at it. #justdoit

‚ÄúSmiling doesn‚Äôt win you gold medals.‚Äù - @simonebiles

It‚Äôs Simone‚Äôs intense focus, energy, and relentless drive that have made her the best to ever do it. And by testing her own limits once again this week at the World Championships, she now has 25 medals ‚Äî making her the most decorated world champion in gymnastics history. #üêê #justdoit

‚ÄúI run to prove to any human in this universe that there are no limitations.‚Äù @kipchogeeliud
A crazy dream come true ‚Äî Eliud Kipchoge becomes the world‚Äôs first to run a marathon in under two hours. #justdoit

"Players are role models for a lot of people. You know, once you get on a football field, to see all of the different backgrounds on each team, it's quite a remarkable thing. I do think that sport, football, plays a big role." - @sterling7

Raheem Sterling, Marcus Rashford, and Tammy Abraham celebrate Black History Month UK and stand together as more than teammates.
‚†Ä
Until we all win. #justdoit

‚ÄúWhen people see me in the gym, I get a variety of responses. If someone knows someone that uses a prosthesis, they‚Äôll tell me, ‚ÄòHey,I know this person that just got an amputation. She's really struggling, but I‚Äôm gonna tell her she‚Äôll be able to do this stuff.‚Äô And that, hands down, makes it all worth it. Sport can show you how to be strong‚Äînot just physicality, but emotionally and mentally.‚Äù - @onelegtostandon
#sportchangeseverything

‚ÄúYour dream starts as a kid. You get older and your aspirations grow, because you believe you can do it.‚Äù -@rafaelnadal
‚†Ä
Rafa wins his 19th major. One shy of tying the all-time men‚Äôs record. #justdoit

‚ÄúI decided to move on from playing ball as a career, but I never actually left the game.
‚†Ä
I went to the rec center just for the pure enjoyment of the game, playing, having fun with my friends, and also focusing on another target in terms of my goals.‚Äù ‚Äî @brandwills telling the story of how basketball sparked a love of, and career in, fashion.
#sportchangeseverything

‚ÄúOur team is younger and more aggressive than before. We need to show the fighting spirit in the game. We‚Äôre hoping to influence the whole game through a positive mindset and contribute to Chinese basketball.‚Äù ‚Äì @yi_jl
‚†Ä
As the leader and veteran of China‚Äôs basketball team, Yi Jianlian dreams that the young team will make a mark in this year‚Äôs FIBA World Cup, continuing to grow visibility and participation in Chinese basketball.
‚†Ä
#justdoit #BeTheProof

‚ÄúWhen I was in the recreational gymnastics classes with a bunch of other girls my age, it was discouraging for a while because I would look over and see them doing these amazing skills. You think to yourself, "What if I had started early? That could be me right now."
‚†Ä
Because I started later, I‚Äôve had to work a lot on positive affirmations. No matter how far I end up going with gymnastics, I just want to show everyone I‚Äôm willing to try. So, instead of ‚Äúwhat if,‚Äù it‚Äôs more like, ‚Äúwhat can happen now?‚Äù ‚Äî Faith Moulton #sportchangeseverything

‚ÄúI like seeing more diverse women in tennis. It makes me feel part of a community where someone like you and someone like me could make their own boxes to be in.‚Äù - Zoe
‚†Ä
This weekend, while the best in the game are in Queens, the future watches and waits.
Drawing inspiration from those who‚Äôve defied tradition and made a mark on the court today, they‚Äôre determined to leave a dent tomorrow. #SportChangesEverything
This is what it looks like to be an 18-time Grand Slam winner. #justdoit

@rafaelnadal: Birthplace of Dreams

‚ÄúMallorca is home. I plan to be here for the rest of my life.‚Äù - @rafaelnadal
‚†Ä
On the eastern coast of the Spanish island of Mallorca is the small town of Manacor. It‚Äôs a community known for fishing, furniture, and a bustling street market.
‚†Ä
But above all else, it‚Äôs a town known for tennis.
‚†Ä
Tennis legend Rafael Nadal‚Äôs career began here, on the red-clay courts sprinkled throughout his hometown of Manacor. And he still calls this place home, training and leading the next generation at the Rafa Nadal Academy.
‚†Ä
This is his Birthplace of Dreams. #justdoit

‚ÄúMany of the children‚Äôs physical fitness is very poor now. Although I can‚Äôt spend a lot of money to buy equipment for the children, I can create equipment for them with my hands.‚Äù - Lin Meizhen

@forrestneide: Don‚Äôt Change Your Dreams

‚ÄúEverything that was taken from me, every opportunity I was denied... That‚Äôs what I want these kids to have.‚Äù - @forrestneide

The five square miles of Capao Redondo, Brazil were once notorious for violence.
